str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.
This; he, she, it.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A head of a household. From oikos and despotes; the head of a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To irritate, provoke, be angry. From orge; to provoke or enrage, i.e. become exasperated.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Soon, quickly, hastily. Adverb from tachus; briefly, i.e. speedily, or rapidly.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A street, public square, broad way. Feminine of platus; a wide 'plat' or 'place', i.e. Open square.
And, even, also, namely.
A narrow street or lane in a town or city. Prolongation from rhoumai in its original sense; an alley or avenue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To lead in, bring in, introduce. From eis and ago; to introduce.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
Crippled, maimed. From ana and peros; crippled.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
And, even, also, namely.
Lame, deprived of a foot, limping. Apparently a primary word; 'halt', i.e. Limping.
